item.title: Flight Management Computer Systems (FMCS) – Both FMC's/CDU's Inoperative

remarks.para: Except for ER operations, may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Both Fuel Quantity Indicating System (FQIS) processor channels are verified to be operative,
All flight deck fuel quantity indications are operative, and
En route operations do not require its use.
Reference AOM Ch. 4, DISPATCH WITH BOTH FMC'S INOPERATIVE, for detailed operational considerations.
Complete IRS alignment using the overhead IRS Mode Selector Panel. Reference AOM Ch. 4, NAVIGATION, for detailed procedures.
Use of Engine and Wing Anti-ice is unaffected. Conversion of TAT and SAT in cruise may be derived from the One Engine INOP chart in the QRH.
Monitor fuel usage for agreement with flight plan. At a minimum, verify fuel quantity from top of climb to top of descent at half hour intervals.
Record zero fuel weight on flight plan to determine takeoff and landing weights by adding fuel on board.
Modify the FAA filing suffix to the appropriate code.
LNAV/VNAV not available to crew.
FMS RNAV type 1 or 2 SIDS/STARS prohibited.
Route of flight to remain within service volume of ground based NAV AIDS. RNAV waypoints and procedures not authorized.

note.para: For operations to Central, South American and Mexico destinations ONLY, the flight may not depart outbound domestic gateways with inoperative Flight Management Computer (FMC), but may continue series of flights within the region for the repair interval specified in the Repair Int Category section.

placard.para: Placard Both FMC’s Control Display Units (M76, M77) "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Both FMC's INOP
maintenance.para: Perform the following test to determine if FQIS processor channels operate normally:

note.para: It is preferable that this test be performed with less than 15,000 lbs (7000 kgs) total fuel.

numlitem.para: Apply electrical power per AMM 24-22-00. Close the battery and RIGHT DC BUS circuit breakers.
Close the fueling panel door.
Open the FUEL QTY L and FUEL QTY R circuit breakers on the P11 overhead panel.
Verify that the FUEL QTY displays have gone blank.
Test FQIS processor channels:
Close FUEL QTY L circuit breaker, wait ten seconds, and record the indicated fuel quantity for each tank.
Open FUEL QTY L circuit breaker and then close FUEL QTY R circuit breaker, wait ten seconds, and record the indicated fuel quantity for each tank.
Compare the quantities recorded in steps 5A and 5B. If quantities differ by 400 lbs (200 kgs) or less per tank, the fuel quantity indicating processor unit is acceptable.
